member.name: T:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility
member.summary: Provides integration with ActiveRecord framework.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility.Init
member.summary: The custom initialization for the Facility.
member.remarks: It must be overriden.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.ActiveRecordFacility.Dispose
member.summary: Performs the tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting the facility resources.
member.remarks: It can be overriden.

member.name: T:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy
member.summary: This class implements and delegates and to as the session is in fact managed by ActiveRecord framework

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.#ctor(Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.ISessionFactoryHolder,NHibernate.ISession)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Flush
member.summary: Force the ISession to flush.
member.remarks: Must be called at the end of a unit of work, before commiting the transaction and closing the session (Transaction.Commit() calls this method). Flushing if the process of synchronising the underlying persistent store with persistable state held in memory.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect the ISession from the current ADO.NET connection.
member.returns: The connection provided by the application or
member.remarks: If the connection was obtained by Hibernate, close it or return it to the connection pool. Otherwise return it to the application. This is used by applications which require long transactions.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Reconnect
member.summary: Obtain a new ADO.NET connection.
member.remarks: This is used by applications which require long transactions

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Reconnect(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary: Reconnect to the given ADO.NET connection.
member.remarks: This is used by applications which require long transactions

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Close
member.summary: End the ISession by disconnecting from the ADO.NET connection and cleaning up.
member.returns: The connection provided by the application or
member.remarks: It is not strictly necessary to Close() the ISession but you must at least Disconnect() it.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CancelQuery
member.summary: Cancel execution of the current query.
member.remarks: May be called from one thread to stop execution of a query in another thread. Use with care!

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.IsDirty
member.summary: Does this ISession contain any changes which must be synchronized with the database? Would any SQL be executed if we flushed this session?

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetIdentifier(System.Object)
member.summary: Return the identifier of an entity instance cached by the ISession
member.remarks: Throws an exception if the instance is transient or associated with a different ISession

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Is this instance associated with this Session?
member.param: an instance of a persistent class
member.returns: true if the given instance is associated with this Session

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Evict(System.Object)
member.summary: Remove this instance from the session cache.
member.remarks: Changes to the instance will not be synchronized with the database. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="all" or cascade="all-delete-orphan".

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Load(System.Type,System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Return the persistent instance of the given entity class with the given identifier, obtaining the specified lock mode.
member.param: A valid identifier of an existing persistent instance of the class

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Load(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Return the persistent instance of the given entity class with the given identifier, assuming that the instance exists.
member.param: A valid identifier of an existing persistent instance of the class
member.remarks: You should not use this method to determine if an instance exists (use a query or instead). Use this only to retrieve an instance that you assume exists, where non-existence would be an actual error.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Load``1(System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Loads the specified id.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Load``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Loads the specified id.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Load(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Read the persistent state associated with the given identifier into the given transient instance.
member.param: An "empty" instance of the persistent class
A valid identifier of an existing persistent instance of the class

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Get(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Return the persistent instance of the given entity class with the given identifier, or null if there is no such persistent instance. (If the instance, or a proxy for the instance, is already associated with the session, return that instance or proxy.)

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Get(System.Type,System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Return the persistent instance of the given entity class with the given identifier, or null if there is no such persistent instance. Obtain the specified lock mode if the instance exists.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Get(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Return the persistent instance of the given named entity with the given identifier, or null if there is no such persistent instance. (If the instance, or a proxy for the instance, is already associated with the session, return that instance or proxy.)

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Get``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the specified id.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Get``1(System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Gets the specified id.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.EnableFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Enable the named filter for this current session.
member.param: The name of the filter to be enabled.
member.returns: The Filter instance representing the enabled fiter.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetEnabledFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a currently enabled filter by name.
member.param: The name of the filter to be retrieved.
member.returns: The Filter instance representing the enabled fiter.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.DisableFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Disable the named filter for the current session.
member.param: The name of the filter to be disabled.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateMultiQuery
member.summary: Create a multi query, a query that can send several queries to the server, and return all their results in a single call.
member.returns: An that can return a list of all the results of all the queries. Note that each query result is itself usually a list.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Replicate(System.Object,NHibernate.ReplicationMode)
member.summary: Persist all reachable transient objects, reusing the current identifier values. Note that this will not trigger the Interceptor of the Session.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Replicate(System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.ReplicationMode)
member.summary: Persist the state of the given detached instance, reusing the current identifier value. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="replicate".
member.param: a detached instance of a persistent class

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Save(System.Object)
member.summary: Persist the given transient instance, first assigning a generated identifier.
member.param: A transient instance of a persistent class
member.remarks: Save will use the current value of the identifier property if the Assigned generator is used.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Save(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Persist the given transient instance, using the given identifier.
member.param: A transient instance of a persistent class

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Save(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Persist the given transient instance, first assigning a generated identifier. (Or using the current value of the identifier property if the assigned generator is used.)
member.param: a transient instance of a persistent class
member.remarks: This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="save-update".

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.SaveOrUpdate(System.Object)
member.summary: Either Save() or Update() the given instance, depending upon the value of its identifier property.
member.param: A transient instance containing new or updated state
member.remarks: By default the instance is always saved. This behaviour may be adjusted by specifying an unsaved-value attribute of the identifier property mapping

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.SaveOrUpdate(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Either or the given instance, depending upon resolution of the unsaved-value checks (see the manual for discussion of unsaved-value checking).
member.param: a transient or detached instance containing new or updated state
member.remarks: This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="save-update".

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Update(System.Object)
member.summary: Update the persistent instance with the identifier of the given transient instance.
member.param: A transient instance containing updated state
member.remarks: If there is a persistent instance with the same identifier, an exception is thrown. If the given transient instance has a identifier, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Update(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Update the persistent state associated with the given identifier.
member.param: A transient instance containing updated state
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if there is a persistent instance with the same identifier in the current session.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Update(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Update the persistent instance with the identifier of the given detached instance.
member.param: a detached instance containing updated state
member.remarks: If there is a persistent instance with the same identifier, an exception is thrown. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="save-update".

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Merge(System.Object)
member.summary:
Copy the state of the given object onto the persistent object with the same identifier. If there is no persistent instance currently associated with the session, it will be loaded. Return the persistent instance. If the given instance is unsaved, save a copy of and return it as a newly persistent instance. The given instance does not become associated with the session. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="merge".
The semantics of this method are defined by JSR-220.
member.param: a detached instance with state to be copied

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Merge(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Copy the state of the given object onto the persistent object with the same identifier. If there is no persistent instance currently associated with the session, it will be loaded. Return the persistent instance. If the given instance is unsaved, save a copy of and return it as a newly persistent instance. The given instance does not become associated with the session. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="merge".
The semantics of this method are defined by JSR-220.
member.param: a detached instance with state to be copied

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Persist(System.Object)
member.summary:
Make a transient instance persistent. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="persist".
The semantics of this method are defined by JSR-220.
member.param: a transient instance to be made persistent

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Persist(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Make a transient instance persistent. This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="persist".
The semantics of this method are defined by JSR-220.
member.param: a transient instance to be made persistent

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.SaveOrUpdateCopy(System.Object)
member.summary: Copy the state of the given object onto the persistent object with the same identifier. If there is no persistent instance currently associated with the session, it will be loaded. Return the persistent instance. If the given instance is unsaved or does not exist in the database, save it and return it as a newly persistent instance. Otherwise, the given instance does not become associated with the session.
member.param: a transient instance with state to be copied

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.SaveOrUpdateCopy(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Copy the state of the given object onto the persistent object with the given identifier. If there is no persistent instance currently associated with the session, it will be loaded. Return the persistent instance. If there is no database row with the given identifier, save the given instance and return it as a newly persistent instance. Otherwise, the given instance does not become associated with the session.
member.param: a persistent or transient instance with state to be copied
the identifier of the instance to copy to

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Delete(System.Object)
member.summary: Remove a persistent instance from the datastore.
member.remarks: The argument may be an instance associated with the receiving ISession or a transient instance with an identifier associated with existing persistent state.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Execute a query
member.param: A query expressed in Hibernate's query language
member.remarks: See for implications of cache usage.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Find(System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.Type.IType)
member.summary: Execute a query, binding a value to a "?" parameter in the query string.
member.param: A value to be bound to a "?" placeholder
The Hibernate type of the value
member.remarks: See for implications of cache usage.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Find(System.String,System.Object[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Execute a query, binding an array of values to a "?" parameters in the query string.
member.param: An array of values to be bound to the "?" placeholders
An array of Hibernate types of the values
member.remarks: See for implications of cache usage.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Enumerable(System.String)
member.summary: Execute a query and return the results in an interator.

remarks.para: If the query has multiple return values, values will be returned in an array of type object[].
Entities returned as results are initialized on demand. The first SQL query returns identifiers only. So Enumerator() is usually a less efficient way to retrieve object than List().

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Enumerable(System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.Type.IType)
member.summary: Execute a query and return the results in an interator, binding a value to a "?" parameter in the query string.
member.param: A value to be written to a "?" placeholder in the query string
The hibernate type of the value

remarks.para: If the query has multiple return values, values will be returned in an array of type object[].
Entities returned as results are initialized on demand. The first SQL query returns identifiers only. So Enumerator() is usually a less efficient way to retrieve object than List().

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Enumerable(System.String,System.Object[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Execute a query and return the results in an interator, binding the values to "?"s parameters in the query string.
member.param: A list of values to be written to "?" placeholders in the query
A list of hibernate types of the values

remarks.para: If the query has multiple return values, values will be returned in an array of type object[].
Entities returned as results are initialized on demand. The first SQL query returns identifiers only. So Enumerator() is usually a less efficient way to retrieve object than List().

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Filter(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Apply a filter to a persistent collection.
member.remarks: A filter is a Hibernate query that may refer to this, the collection element. Filters allow efficient access to very large lazy collections. (Executing the filter does not initialize the collection.)

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Filter(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.Type.IType)
member.summary: Apply a filter to a persistent collection, binding the given parameter to a "?" placeholder
member.param: A value to be written to a "?" placeholder in the query
member.remarks: A filter is a Hibernate query that may refer to this, the collection element. Filters allow efficient access to very large lazy collections. (Executing the filter does not initialize the collection.)

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Filter(System.Object,System.String,System.Object[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Apply a filter to a persistent collection, binding the given parameters to "?" placeholders.
member.param: The values to be written to "?" placeholders in the query
The hibernate types of the values
member.remarks: A filter is a Hibernate query that may refer to this, the collection element. Filters allow efficient access to very large lazy collections. (Executing the filter does not initialize the collection.)

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetEntityName(System.Object)
member.summary: Return the entity name for a persistent entity

member.summary: Sets the batch size of the session

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateMultiCriteria
member.summary: An that can return a list of all the results of all the criterias.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Delete all objects returned by the query.
member.returns: Returns the number of objects deleted.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Delete(System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.Type.IType)
member.summary: Delete all objects returned by the query.
member.param: A value to be written to a "?" placeholer in the query

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Delete(System.String,System.Object[],NHibernate.Type.IType[])
member.summary: Delete all objects returned by the query.

A list of Hibernate types of the values

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Lock(System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Obtain the specified lock level upon the given object.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Lock(System.String,System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Obtain the specified lock level upon the given object.
member.remarks: This may be used to perform a version check (), to upgrade to a pessimistic lock (), or to simply reassociate a transient instance with a session (). This operation cascades to associated instances if the association is mapped with cascade="lock".

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Refresh(System.Object)
member.summary: Re-read the state of the given instance from the underlying database.

remarks.para: It is inadvisable to use this to implement long-running sessions that span many business tasks. This method is, however, useful in certain special circumstances.

For example,
Where a database trigger alters the object state upon insert or update
After executing direct SQL (eg. a mass update) in the same session
After inserting a Blob or Clob

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Refresh(System.Object,NHibernate.LockMode)
member.summary: Re-read the state of the given instance from the underlying database, with the given LockMode.
member.remarks: It is inadvisable to use this to implement long-running sessions that span many business tasks. This method is, however, useful in certain special circumstances.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetCurrentLockMode(System.Object)
member.summary: Determine the current lock mode of the given object

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Begin a unit of work and return the associated ITransaction object.
member.remarks: If a new underlying transaction is required, begin the transaction. Otherwise continue the new work in the context of the existing underlying transaction. The class of the returned object is determined by the property transaction_factory

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.BeginTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Begin a transaction with the specified isolationLevel
member.param: Isolation level for the new transaction
member.returns: A transaction instance having the specified isolation level

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateCriteria(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates a new Criteria for the entity class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateCriteria(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Criteria for the entity class with a specific alias

member.summary: Create a new instance of Query for the given query string

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateFilter(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of Query for the given collection and filter string

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetNamedQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Obtain an instance of for a named query string defined in the mapping file.
member.param: The name of a query defined externally.
member.returns: An from a named query string.
member.remarks: The query can be either in HQL or SQL format.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateSQLQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of for the given SQL query string.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateSQLQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Create a new instance of IQuery for the given SQL string.
member.param: a table alias that appears inside {} in the SQL string

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CreateSQLQuery(System.String,System.String[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Create a new instance of for the given SQL string.
member.param: an array of table aliases that appear inside {} in the SQL string

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Clear
member.summary: Completely clear the session. Evict all loaded instances and cancel all pending saves, updates and deletions. Do not close open enumerables or instances of ScrollableResults.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetSessionImplementation
member.summary: Gets the session implementation.
member.returns: An NHibernate implementation of the interface
member.remarks: This method is provided in order to get the NHibernate implementation of the session from wrapper implementions. Implementors of the interface should return the NHibernate implementation of this method.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.GetSession(NHibernate.EntityMode)
member.summary: Starts a new Session with the given entity mode in effect. This secondary Session inherits the connection, transaction, and other context information from the primary Session. It doesn't need to be flushed or closed by the developer.
member.param: The entity mode to use for the new session.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.FlushMode
member.summary: Determines at which points Hibernate automatically flushes the session.
member.remarks: For a readonly session, it is reasonable to set the flush mode to FlushMode.Never at the start of the session (in order to achieve some extra performance).

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.SessionFactory
member.summary: Get the that created this instance.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Connection
member.summary: Gets the ADO.NET connection.
member.remarks: Applications are responsible for calling commit/rollback upon the connection before closing the ISession.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.IsOpen
member.summary: Is the ISession still open?

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.IsConnected
member.summary: Is the ISession currently connected?

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Transaction
member.summary: Get the current Unit of Work and return the associated ITransaction object.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.CacheMode
member.summary: The current cache mode.
member.remarks: Cache mode determines the manner in which this session can interact with the second level cache.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.Statistics
member.summary: Get the statistics for this session.

member.name: P:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SafeSessionProxy.ActiveEntityMode
member.summary: Gets the active entity mode.

member.name: T:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SessionFactoryDelegate
member.summary: Implements allowing it to be used by the container as an ordinary component. However only is implemented

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.SessionFactoryDelegate.Create(Castle.ActiveRecord.Framework.ISessionFactoryHolder,System.Type)
member.summary: Creates the specified session factory delegate from the holder and root type

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.TransactionScopeResourceAdapter.Start
member.summary: Implementors should start the transaction on the underlying resource

member.name: M:Castle.Facilities.ActiveRecordIntegration.TransactionScopeResourceAdapter.Commit
member.summary: Implementors should commit the transaction on the underlying resource

member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
